sources.data_found: On-premise system consists of two Cisco blades with a terabyte of RAM in each one. The blades have Intel Xeon Gold 6238 CPUs and up to 44 cores per blade. No GPU resources mentioned.
2023 total enrollment: 9,545 students. 3,629 undergraduate and 5,916 graduate students. Most specialized majors include Psychology (1,061 degrees), Business (1,190 degrees)
Computer Science major and minor programs offered. Combination of in-class instruction, internships, and capstone course prepares CS majors for careers or graduate school.
2021-2022: 15 bachelor's degrees in mathematics & computer science (25% increase from 12 previous year)

student_data.notes: Based on 15 Math & CS bachelor's degrees awarded in 2021-2022 × 4 years = ~60 undergrads. No graduate CS programs found. Pepperdine does not offer PhD in CS.

gpu_resources.notes: Pepperdine's research computing resources are CPU-only (Intel Xeon Gold 6238). No GPU resources found in any searches.

analysis_notes: Pepperdine is a smaller private university with limited research computing infrastructure. They offer undergraduate CS programs but no graduate CS degrees. Research computing consists of CPU-only resources with no GPU availability.
